com.canoo.dolphin.server.container

Interface ContainerManager


  • public interface ContainerManager

    This interface defines the platform / container specific controller management. By default Dolphin Platform provides 2 implementations of this interface for Spring and JavaEE that can be found in the specific modules. If you want to add the support for a different platform you need to provide a custom implementation of this interface.

    Here is a short overview how the architecture is defined:

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> T createListener(Class<T> listenerClass)
      Creates a new managed instance.
      <T> T createManagedController(Class<T> controllerClass, ModelInjector modelInjector)
      Creates a new managed instance for the given controller class.
      void destroyController(Object instance, Class controllerClass)
      Destroyes the given controller instance
      void init(javax.servlet.ServletContext servletContext)
      This method must be called before the ContainerManager instance can be used.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(javax.servlet.ServletContext servletContext)
        This method must be called before the ContainerManager instance can be used. Some specific implementations needs access to the ServletContext that is set by calling this method.
        Parameters:
        servletContext - the servlet context

      • createManagedController

        <T> T createManagedController(Class<T> controllerClass,
                              ModelInjector modelInjector)
        Creates a new managed instance for the given controller class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the controller
        Parameters:
        controllerClass - the class of the controller
        modelInjector - a injector that will be called to inject the model in the controller
        Returns:
        the new controller instance

      • createListener

        <T> T createListener(Class<T> listenerClass)
        Creates a new managed instance. See DolphinListener and DolphinSessionListener for more information
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the listener
        Parameters:
        listenerClass - the class of the listenerClass
        Returns:
        the new listener instance

      • destroyController

        void destroyController(Object instance,
                       Class controllerClass)
        Destroyes the given controller instance
        Parameters:
        instance - controller instance
        controllerClass - type of controller
